segments.text: I see a woman focused on polishing a plate, her attention completely absorbed in the task at hand.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I can’t help but notice that the sink is overflowing, water spilling over and pooling at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems blissfully unaware of the chaos around her, as if nothing out of the ordinary is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside the window looks so peaceful, a stark contrast to the chaos in the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can hear the water splashing onto the floor, almost like a warning bell.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the boy is climbing on that unstable stool, and my heart sinks at the thought of him falling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why can't she just look up for a moment and see what is going on behind her?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl next to him looks excited, her arm raised as if asking for a cookie, completely oblivious to the risk.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like a scene from a comedy, but I can’t laugh; it feels too precarious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s an almost palpable tension in the air, a sense of impending doom.
segments.speaker: PAR
